Crafting Shots

Making shots can be done by someone with @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.wKwel9MG7NIG3i3w]{Trade (Alchemist)} or @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.Ml6ZblglcSbVhXyh]{Trade (Smith)} (or anyone really, as long as they know how to properly melt metal and cast using moulds, with the exception being @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shots}).

  • They are being crafted by melting the raw metal and casting.

  • Raw metal costs 1/4th of the ammunition price. (easier to just multiply by 3 if you craft full batch)

    • Or can be prepared by an Alchemist beforehand

  • Process takes 3 hours.

  • Make an Average (+20) Trade (Alchemy or Smith) to see if you succeeded. Every +1 SL allows you to cast 5% more shots up to bonus of 20%

Casting @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-up-in-arms.items.Item.VlzGxkiCI1q4aa5c]{Precision Shot} requires good quality mould, which is a @Pay[10gc]{10 GC, Rare} item, that could be prepared by an @UUID[JournalEntry.4spGTAnh7qc2JDqY.JournalEntryPage.TwuMMg4t9QPf89rT#mundane-alchemy]{Alchemist} in a week and a successful Hard (-20) Alchemy Test.

Other moulds cost @Pay[1gc]{1 GC, Scarce} and can be made by an Alchemist or a Smith by spending a day of work and a successful Average (+20) Trade Test.

New Action: Hold

During your @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.wmA76Q2zJJ9HrkvA#taking-your-turn]{turn}, you may choose to hold your @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.wmA76Q2zJJ9HrkvA#action]{action}. If you do so, you may @UUID[JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.wmA76Q2zJJ9HrkvA#move]{Move} as normal, but may not take an Action this Round. Instead, you may state what you intend to do when a certain condition is met. So, for example, you may state that you intend to fire your Crossbow at the first Cultist to walk into the room, use your Intimidate Skill on the next bandit to move, or that you intend to cast the Light spell as soon as the room is plunged into darkness. When using this action, you effectively interrupt your opponent's turn, and your Action is resolved before any other. If there is a conflict between several hold actions, resolve them in the usual initiative order. Due to the quick and hurried nature of your Action, any Skill Tests are made at a -10 penalty.

Point Blank Range

Officially, a PBR (Point Blank Range) for Ranged weapons is up to 10% of Weapon's listed Range. The problem arises when weapons like Longbow, Hochland Long Rifle or an Elf Bow are considered. They would have PBR up to 10 or 15 yards/meters! That's 5-7 squares! It's way too much for these weapons.

Therefore, all Ranged Weapons should be considered to have PBR up to 4 yards or 10% of their range, whichever is lower.

For that, use of @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.95teaIzjZcIDHTFn]{Point Blank Rule} trait on every character and NPC is encouraged.

Runebound Magic

Runebound magic is innate ability of the Runebound, artificially enhanced Humans. However, not every Runebound can use the magic and even among those that can, not all are proficient at the same level.

Unlike Arcane Magic, Runebound Magic does not require spoken chants. It uses @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.V8eRx66SxB9Jha0Q]{Channelling} to gather and move Winds through the body and form spells by hand signs and gestures. Therefore, a Runebound wanting to use Runebound Magic (called Runes or Runebound Spells) needs to have at least one hand free.

  • Runes can be cast and channelled. Both actions use the same skill.

  • Runes can be dispelled as any other magic.

  • All Runes count as magical source of damage.

  • Minor Miscasts are ignored and Major Miscasts become Minor instead

  • Runes can only be accessed when talent @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.XK4JNjFfh6xqui0k]{Runebound Magic} is purchased

  • "Memorized" Runes can be cast using Free Action once per Round.

    • @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Item.tXKX29QZBdHmyMc7]{Combat Reflexes} Talent allows to use Runes while using two-handed weapons (of any Category). This reflects the required reflexes to quickly use one hand to form a Rune while using two-handed weapons without any penalties.

    • Runes can only be Memorized through the @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.XK4JNjFfh6xqui0k]{Runebound Magic} Talent

Dwarven Runes

Rules for Runes

Rule of Three

Maximum of three Runes can be engraved on a single item.

Rule of Pride

Runesmiths don't like repeating itself and they treat their work with utmost respect. Unless very specific circumstances, they will not make an item identical to one they already made.

Rule of Time

Only one Rune can be worked on at the same time.

Rule of Form

Runes must be engraved on an item of appropriate type. Furthermore, they need to be carved in a solid, resilient substance like metal, wood, bone and stone. Soft and brittle materials like leather, fabric, paper, ceramic are not suitable for the Art of Runecrafting!

Rule of Mastery

Master Runes are too powerful to share an artifact with other runes. Master Runes count as 3 Runes for the purpose of Rule of Three.

Creating a Rune

To be able to create a rune, a character must meet these requirements:

  • Must be a dwarf,

  • Must have a Runecraft skill,

  • Must know a Rune; either by using a Dawi Runes talent or by having exact recipe to read,

  • Must have a Language (Magick) skill,

  • Must have a workshop and tools.

Creating runes happens in three steps:

  1. Engraving — Runesmith needs to engrave runes on the item, it requires a Dramatic Challenging (+0) Art (Engraving) Test, where any success allows for a temporary rune and an Impressive Success (+4 SL) allows for a permanent rune. Process takes 4 hours.

    • Engraving Master Runes requires an Astounding Success (+6 SL) for Permanent effect and a Success (+3 SL) for a Temporary effect

  2. Empowering — Runesmith needs to fill the rune with magical power. To do this, an Extended Runecrafting Test with target SL being the Power statistic found in the specific rune's description. For permanent runes, the target SL is 10 times higher. Every Test represents one hour of work and Runesmith can only Empower the Rune for a maximum of Willpower Bonus hours a day.

    • Optionally — Empowering Permanent Runes may require Rune's Power SL, but then each Test represents a Week of daily work

  3. Binding — Runesmith needs to bind the power in the rune and close it. This step does not require a Test, only time. Time is equal to Rune's Power days for permanent Runes and Rune's Power x10 minutes for temporary Runes.

Ways to Fail

There are number of ways a Runecrafting can fail. Here are some examples, but as always, GM's choice:

  1. During Engraving, if test fails, an Item receives 1 Damage (if applicable) and Runecrafting cannot be performed on that item unless it's repaired/mended. If test results in a Fumble, Item receives cannot be Engraved even when repaired/mended.

  2. When Empowering, a Fumble during any roll of the Extended Test results in a "Failed Empowering Attempt" and the effect can range from "just wasted time" through "weapon explodes" to a "spawn of chaos". GM's choice really. [Maybe To Do a Rollable Table]

  3. When Binding a Permanent Rune, if a Runesmith skip a day, there is a chance that power of the Rune dissipates and Rune immediately changes into a Temporary one. There is also a chance that power will explode, injuring Runesmith on the next attempt.

Becoming a Runebound

Transitioning from Human to Runebound is dangerous and highly discouraged. It involves months of drug and magic therapy that is more than likely to destroy bodies of most men. And even if they survive, it cannot be guaranteed the same for their mind and soul.

Mechanically, a Character transitioning needs to complete an Average Extended Toughness Test with target SL being equal to double the age in years, but no less than 20. You can attempt one roll towards the Extended Test per in-game week. If at any point, total SL of this test falls into negatives, character dies (or mutates beyond recognition and becomes a chaos spawn, up to GM). Same happens if any of the rolls Fumbles.

After a Character completes the Extended Toughness Test, they need to perform a Hard (-20) Willpower Test. If they fail, immediately gain one mental corruption.

Benefits of becoming a Runebound

When you become a Runebound, immediately gain following Talents/Traits. If you already have one of these talents you can take another level or reroll, up to you.

Talents: Mutation*, 4 Random Talents

* Since becoming a Runebound is somewhat controlled ritual, Mutations gained at this point are mostly aesthetics. Choose one that's cool, but be ready for consequences. If GM decides, they can modify your characteristics by up to -3/+3.

Additionally, when you become a Runebound, you change some of your characteristics:

  • Add +5 to all basic Characteristics except Fel and Int, both of which suffer -5

  • Reset Movement to 4,

  • Lower Resilience to 2,

  • Lower Fate to 1,

  • Gain +1 extra point to assign to Resilience or Fate.

Negatives of being a Runebound

Runebounds are OP. They are meant to be. After all, they were created to be super-human beast-fighting monsters. However, they are arguably more dangerous character to play than any other.

  • Runebounds are actively being hunted by many, including some rogue or self-righteous Witch Hunters and Wizards. If your GM decided that Monster Hunter Guild is operating publicly in your World, then Runebound should have a "license", but this still won't stop all of the Witch Hunters.

  • From the common folk point of view, Runebounds are not that different from Mutants, Cultists and Heretics. Unknown must mean Ruinous Powers after all! Common Folk fears and sometimes even hates Runebounds. Try to hide your mutations in public!

  • You can never gain talents like Arcane Magic, Petty Magic, Chaos Magic, Invoke, Bless etc. If you were to try and use magic or any other mystical power in other way than a Runebound Magic, your body would disintegrate.

  • You are sterile, you can never have offspring

This module offers a lot of features that may not be apparent by just looking at the content compendiums. Here I will try to present and explain them.

Keep in mind than many of these features needs to be first enabled in the module @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{Settings Configuration}, where you can also find many options to customize how the module works!.

Arrow Reclamation

This feature is disabled by default.

Allows players to recover some portion of their fired arrows, bolts and sling bullets after the combat ends. Must be enabled in @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{settings}, where you can also find additional configuration of this feature, such as choice of reclamation rules, chances and what type of ammunition allow to be recovered.

Runes

This feature is always running.

Whenever any temporary "Rune" (by which this module calls Active Effects that represent Dwarven Magic Runes) is disabled, the module will automatically delete it from the item.

This feature works with all shipped Runes as well as your custom one if they follow the Rune of ABC (Temporary) naming convention.

Destroyed Runes Damage Item

This feature is disabled by default.

Additionally, in module's @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{settings}, you can enable another rune feature, which causes destroyed Runes to cause 1 Damage to the item.

Magic Scrolls

This feature is always running.

Thanks to WFRP4e transition to Data Models in 7.1.0, modules can now more easily create custom Item types. Yes, no longer we are forced to do shenanigans or hijack existing types.

Because of that I was able to introduce concept of Magic Scroll type Item. This Item type is derivative of Physical Item, meaning it's like a Trapping. What makes it very powerful is that you can drag&drop a Spell onto a Magic Scroll, which will attach one to another.

Magic Scrolls can be written in any language and then they can be used by any character who knows that language, allowing them to cast a Spell from the Scroll, without having to temporarily add Spell Item to Actor.

Check @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{settings} for more customization on how Magic Scrolls behave.

There is also improved @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.8NvSmvxkiOdLt3HW]{Generate Random Scroll} Macro, that will generate new Magic Scroll items with selected spells

Checking Careers

In Macro Compendium, you can find the @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.MrggtmSEdMnNgOL2]{Check Careers! (all)} and @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.X6PfKZ7ycRJhb6yX]{Check Career!} macros.

When used, they allow GM and Players to easily check their career and progress and quickly see how many Characteristics, Skills and Talents they already have and what they are missing in order to complete current career.

Combat Fatigue

This feature is disabled by default.

Implementing optional ruleset "Getting Tired" (found @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.journals.JournalEntry.NS3YGlJQxwTggjRX.JournalEntryPage.SjuV1vgbgM49pFpP#master-condition-list]{here}), this feature will prompt characters to roll an Endurance Test after TB rounds they spend in combat. This feature can be disabled for NPCs.

Please note that this feature affects all Actors in Combat that have and end their turns. It has no idea if those Actors are performing intensive tasks during those turns.

Casting Fatigue

This feature is disabled by default.

This feature has been proposed and designed by Discord user VividOblivion.

Manipulating the winds of magic is difficult.

Whenever a caster attempts a Casting Test, the spell's CN is subtracted from the caster's Magical Endurance. Furthermore, any Channeling attempt subtracts 1* from the caster's Magical Endurance. A caster's Magical Endurance is equal to his TB × WPB*.

When Magical Endurance drops below 0 the caster must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or receive a @Condition[Fatigued] condition. This difficulty of this Test increases by one step for every 5* Magical Endurance below 0.

Every caster will passively regenerate their Magical Endurance in a rate of their Willpower Bonus per hour**.

* This is suggested value, but is configurable via Module's Settings

** This can be automated in @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{Settings Configuration}, when coupled with a time tracking module (such as Simple Calendar)

Item Repair

In Macro Compendium, you can find the @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.Qk0VNcvb77ANwSQY]{Check Equipment for Repairs} and @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.as22aZ3wJdi5EATf]{Check Equipment for Repairs (Free)} macros.

They allow players to create a Chat Card that will outline every damaged item in their character's possesion, with ability to interactively repair them using buttons and automatic price calculation.

More examples of Item Repair macros, that are more narrowed in function can be found in [Macros -> Integrations -> Item Piles] Folder

Automated Disease Progression

This feature is disabled by default.

When coupled with a time tracking module (such as Simple Calendar), and enabled in the module's @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.macros.Macro.q6ITACXwRU45kTcR]{Settings Configuration}, this feature will automatically countdown the Diseases' "incubation" and "duration" values. When a Disease's "incubation" reaches 0, it will activate, its symptoms will appear and the "duration" will start counting down.

Item Properties

This feature is always running.

If you do not wish to use these properties, simply do not use them or items that have them. You can also edit the items (import them first) to remove those properties.

New Qualities

  • Blinding – A Blinding X weapon inflicts X @Condition[Blinded] Conditions to enemy hit.

  • Incendiary – An Incendiary X weapon inflicts one @Condition[Ablaze] Condition on hit, as long as unit die on the Weapon Test rolled less than or equal X.

  • Poisonous – A weapon with Poisonous X inflicts one @Condition[Poisoned] Condition whenever attacker scores at least X SL on Weapon Test.

  • Recoverable – Projectile can be recovered even if it's ammunition group normally cannot. (requires feature enabled in settings)

  • Slashing – A weapon with Slashing X inflicts one @Condition[Bleeding] Condition on a successful hits on locations protected by no more than X Armour Points.

New Flaws

  • Unrecoverable – Projectile always perishes and can never be recovered.

Skills

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.6YlpuNF1A89hA6Pp]{Runecraft} – Allows dwarven @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-homerules.JournalEntry.OVrtFjJzqXZMf0uf.JournalEntryPage.e0UGR1lJQjdA68Er]{Runesmiths} to craft runic items

Talents

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.uHpjp2h82lqMGD4B]{Dawi Runes} – dictates how many @UUID[.1KixRsjyMULqAzSZ#runes]{Runes} a Runesmith knows

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.45vQxqVDSgCAJoLw]{Fighting Master (Style)} – Mastery of one of the Fighting Styles

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.MCQGW6z3fWNdR5hO]{Fighting Master (Evadecraft)}

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.uL8T7Gy9rRq74HIN]{Fighting Master (Ironshield)}

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.F5UwuMe5XHl44Jrt]{Fighting Master (Steelstorm)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.C1bJUJYDZsC6PEBi]{Fighting Style (Any)} – Fighting Styles used by @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-homerules.JournalEntry.OVrtFjJzqXZMf0uf.JournalEntryPage.A8Es3aCGIbGOfuUR]{Monster Hunters}

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.CUWdlx3IhkmTPL57]{Fighting Style (Evadecraft)}

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.Da4zReU57OnesKGd]{Fighting Style (Ironshield)}

    • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.O987u5M0SL46gm3v]{Fighting Style (Steelstorm)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.ngi2RUI37DyUTe0W]{Fortified Mind} – this Talent was designed as a part of @UUID[.LnfVke9w0gwL3Qle#casting-fatigue]{Casting Fatigue} feature and offers little utility on its own.

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.XK4JNjFfh6xqui0k]{Runebound Magic} – allows @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-homerules.JournalEntry.OVrtFjJzqXZMf0uf.JournalEntryPage.lV438LtXZvxHkmmK]{Runebounds} to use their innate magic

Traits

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.0jF3n0qU0JklSQTz]{Drunk} – applies a Characteristics modifier according to rules for failed @UUID[JournalEntry.6zOdTLv3YeYeJ4hR.JournalEntryPage.38Ux3mEWYuQ4heIT]{Consume Alcohol} Tests

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.95teaIzjZcIDHTFn]{Point Blank Rule} – implements the @UUID[.FgCTvVEEBZYysGn1#point-blank-range]{Point Blank Range} rule for that specific character

  • @UUID[Compendium.forien-armoury.forien-armoury.Item.NRVJQWYBfbZsPM4s]{Repulsive} – implements the "halving of Fellowship characteristic" effect that appears during the Enemy Within campaign. Simply add this trait when players should have it, and remove it after they get cleansed.

Before you lies the „RassilonMonk's Cauldron of Nurgle“, a fan-crafted anthology that delves deep into the noxious secrets of the Old World's most despicable Diseases and Symptoms, concocted with the macabre ingenuity of Nurgle himself.

As you navigate this tome, be prepared to encounter afflictions that sprawl from the mundane to the grotesque, each woven with a malecolent creativity to challenge the hardiest of adventures.

Now that we've got our ChatGPT-enhanced intro behind ourselves, let me present you a collection of new Diseases and Symptoms prepared by RassilonMonk, who generously agreed to showcase them in this Armoury.

New Symptoms

  • @Symptom[Vertigo] — applies a penalty to Weapon Tests and Tests based on Agility, Dexterity, and Intelligence

  • @Symptom[Scarring] — applies a penalty to Fellowship Tests

  • @Symptom[Rashes] — applies a penalty to Dexterity and Fellowship Characteristics

  • @Symptom[Wasting] — applies penalties to Strength, Agility, Toughness and Dexterity, as well as all Weapon Tests.

  • @Symptom[Dementia] — applies a penalty to Intelligence and Initiative
